definition: affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means

sentences.english: He launched a brutal kick in batman's face.
sentences.chinese: 他朝着勤务兵的脸野蛮地踹了一脚。

sentences.english: The army's rear services should be readjusted.
sentences.chinese: 军队的后方勤务工作，须重新调整。

sentences.english: We should always be the servants of the people.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该永远做人民的勤务员。

sentences.english: But Sanmao served unexpectedly in the army as an orderly for his company officer.
sentences.chinese: 但是没有想到，三毛进军队后做了连长的勤务兵。

sentences.english: The Armed Police service is one of the central tasks of CAPF.
sentences.chinese: 武警勤务是中国人民武装警察部队中心工作之一。

sentences.english: If not, my servant will give you the dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 如果正好不在，我的勤务员会把词典给你的。

sentences.english: For example: After lavatory service panel inoperative, suspect obstruction.
sentences.chinese: 后厕所勤务面板失效，怀疑有堵塞。

sentences.english: We are all servants of the people.
sentences.chinese: 我们都是人民的勤务员。

sentences.english: Third, the battlefield is the army's duty to protect " all-rounder ."
sentences.chinese: 其三，陆航是战场勤务保障的“多面手”。

sentences.english: On arrival, new recruits should report to the orderly room.
sentences.chinese: 新兵一到就应该到勤务兵房间报到。

sentences.english: Disconnect the air pressure source from the air valve at the water service panel.
sentences.chinese: 从水勤务面板空气活门断开空气压力源。

sentences.english: Every general was accompanied by an orderly.
sentences.chinese: 每个将军都配有一个勤务兵。

sentences.english: The paper designs POL service simulation training framework system.
sentences.chinese: 设计了油料勤务模拟训练系统框架。

sentences.english: The doctor, the prince's valet, and coachman , and two orderlies were in charge of them.
sentences.chinese: 随行的有医生，公爵的随从和马夫及两名勤务兵。

sentences.english: Soldiers on duty as safeguards occupy a protected status.
sentences.chinese: 值护航警卫勤务之士兵拥有被保护地位。

sentences.english: The Research on the Talent Planing Model of the Key Disciplines in Military Medicine;
sentences.chinese: 卫生勤务是军事医学研究中的一个学科。

definition: to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
to search for and seize (criminals, smuggled goods etc)
group/a large body of/production brigade/military group
special duty (e.g. extra security or traffic control on special occasions)/person on special duty
mounted police detachment (on horse or motorbike)
police classification/subdivision of policing activities (traffic, border guard, criminal etc)
